page.title: 07Railway tunnel and viaduct.
page.content: The tunnel is 742 yards long.It had all kinds of trains going through.The same sort of engines went over the viaduct,which is 35 feet long.This viaduct was finished in 1860 and a few years later the line from Salisbury to Yeovil was completed.They had problems with the tunnel.Bricks were used to line the clay.In the early 1920's it was decided to take out some bricks and build an arch for strength.They had no more problems. The last steam engine on the viaduct and through the tunnel was in 1964 apart from special trips for steam enthusiasts. The track has been changed five or six times.The ballast comes from Okehampton in Devon.
